Yea... it actually took three nights to build the original structure.. then=
, LATER ON, all the complicated Nice-ities were added..
=A0
=A0But the actu=
all "battle ready fort" was done in three nights.
=A0
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 In=
 the city of Konan, there is a Maeno family document which reveals alot abo=
ut the Hachisuka, Maeno, Toyotomi, and Oda=A0Nobunaga which is not recorded=
 in other records....
=A0
.... might be worth looking into. Again, it contr=
adicts some "accepted history"... so fair warning.=A0 For example, it says =
that Toyotomi was actually working as a spy for the Hachisuka in the beginn=
ing--- that he was not a peasant at all, but a low ranking samurai working =
as a spy. He was hired by the Ikoma Family and it was Ikoma's daugher that =
introduce Toyotomi to Oda Nobunaga.
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 He worked with the H=
achisuka and Maeno later on as a combination of soldier/spy... in fact, man=
y of the samurai families from the upper Owari area (the Hachisuka, Fukushi=
ma, Kawajiri, Kumazawa, Nojiri, Nakagawa, Maeno=A0etc.etc) of northern Nago=
ya, Ichinomiya, Konan, etc.etc---- most of their family history follows the=
 "spy" version of the story--- not the "peasant" version..but then again, t=
hese families are known to have been spies themselves--- so I guess that it=
 makes sense.
=A0
=A0So, it is worth looking into to get a very different l=
ook on it all.
